description:
11.216 scale_cuda
Scale (resize) and convert (pixel format) the input video, using accelerated CUDA kernels.
Setting the output width and height works in the same way as for the scale filter.

The filter accepts the following options:

force_divisible_by.description: Work the same as the identical scale filter option.

force_original_aspect_ratio.description: Work the same as the identical scale filter option.

format.description: Controls the output pixel format. By default, or if none is specified, the input pixel format is used.

h.description: Set the output video height expression. Default value is the input height.

interp_algo.description: Sets the algorithm used for scaling.

param.description: Algorithm-Specific parameter. Affects the curves of the bicubic algorithm.

passthrough.description: If set to 0, every frame is processed, even if no conversion is necessary. If set to 1, frames are passed through as-is if they match the desired output parameters. This is the default behavior.

w.description: Set the output video width expression. Default value is the input width.
